definitions.definition: To swing back and forth , especially if with a regular rhythm .
examples: A pendulum oscillates slower as it gets longer.

definitions.definition: To vacillate between conflicting opinions , etc.
examples: The mood for change oscillated from day to day.

definitions.definition: To vary above and below a mean value .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To swing back and forth , especially if with a regular rhythm .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To vacillate between conflicting opinions , etc.
( intransitive ) To vary above and below a mean value .
